cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northwest over the northern Yucatan Peninsula late Monday, emerge into the Gulf Tuesday, then turn north-northeast and accelerate toward the northern Gulf Coast Wednesday before sweeping inland across the Southeast toward the Mid-Atlantic Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast (likely southeast Louisiana to Mississippi coastal region)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches confined to Yucatan Peninsula of Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Tulum to Dzilam, Mexico; Tropical Storm Warning south of Tulum to Punta Allen, and west of Dzilam to Progreso, Mexico; Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest coastal impact expected along northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Alabama/Mississippi; lesser impacts inland across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤ tropical-storm force) chance; occasional gusts 20-30 mph possible late Wed night–Thu as remnants pass inland
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Charleston coast given inland track and weak on-shore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain Wednesday night through Thursday, generally 2–4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands as the system moves across the Southeast
